BodyPart.Text: DILIGENT, SINCERE, DISCREET AND ALWAYS CLIENT FOCUSED.

Paul’s previous career was in home renovations. It was while working in this career that Paul learned how important service is to homeowners – this is one of the many skills that Paul has transferred to his real estate career. His firsthand experience as a business owner has also helped him develop expert negotiation skills, and a genuine desire to strive for the best possible outcome for every client.

Paul’s desire to deliver outstanding service is tailored to buyers and sellers needs.

 “I don’t think of myself as a superman real estate agent” he said. “When people are dealing with me I want them to feel good about the process. “My focus is to provide the best service possible. I am committed to excellence and I pay close attention to detail. I put pride in and emphasis on accountability, reliability, timeliness and enthusiasm. I provide all my clients with all the information necessary to help them make the right real estate investment decisions.”

When thinking about buying a home, you should spend time familiarizing yourself with the MLS system, if you have not already, it’s easy to use and can be fun. Realtors.ca has most listings available for your perusal.

Pictures and information are great…but seeing first hand is believing. My background in home renovations is an asset I use to benefit all my clients.

I work closely with my clients to get full understanding of individual buyer needs to help save time and possibly frustration. Together we qualify listings that meet specific required criteria. Many of my clients have busy lives and their time is important. Going through and seeing hundreds of listings is too much…that’s my job!

Your marketing plan to sell your home starts with understanding the target market, I work with you to develop a strategy designed specifically for your home.

Marketing your home is so much more than just listing it on MLS. Todays competitive marketplace demands a Realtor® that does more to sell your home. I will provide you with a home evaluation and all comparable sales information, and work with you on setting the right price.

My marketing plan continually changes as not all homes and sales environments are similar. Understanding each individual situation, and customizing a sales strategy to maximize your home’s exposure will provide the added value you need, deserve, and can expect, when listing with your home with me.

We have it all!

Salt Spring is located between Vancouver Island and the Mainland in the Strait of Georgia alongside its neighbouring islands of Galiano, Pender, Saturna, Maine and Prevost. It is the largest (70 square miles or 180 square kilometres), most populated (10,500) and, some might say most popular, of the Southern Gulf Islands. (insert map) Getting here is easy as we are serviced by BC Ferries at 3 separate terminals with easy access from Vancouver Island as well as direct service from the mainland.

The Island boasts diverse lifestyles for anyone wanting to live here as either a permanent or seasonal resident. No two properties are the same. If you desire an oceanfront property with a place to dock your boat or a serene forested piece of paradise where you can hide and let the stresses of everyday life float away on the breeze, you can find it here.

There are many amenities here on the Island that includes elementary and high schools, banks, grocery stores, recreational facilities, pharmacies, hardware stores and a host of services such as veterinary, dental and our own Lady Minto Hospital. Salt Spring Island also has the archipelago’s only town. Ganges (called “the village” by visitors and “downtown” by residents) is a pedestrian-friendly cluster of cafes, bookstores and many art galleries and craft shops. Salt Spring has one of the most thriving arts communities and could well have more artisans per capita than anywhere else in Canada. Perhaps you are an avid boater? We have everything you need. Being nestled in the Gulf Islands, you can take in the Islands scenery while not having to worry about open ocean winds making your leisure boating or fishing experiences very enjoyable. We have private and public launches as well as many marine services including repair facilities.

Feeling energetic? Salt Spring Island is full of things to do such as cycling, kayaking, hiking, swimming or just taking a walk on the many maintained trails on the Island. With our temperate climate, many of these activities can be done year round.

I have encountered so many residents of the Island that came to visit “for a few days” and simply never left. Come and see what Salt Spring Island has to offer you!
